greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: a(n) = 4^n mod 3^n.
comment: (a(n+1) - 4*a(n))/3^n is always one of -3, -2, -1, 0, 1, 2. - _Robert Israel_, Dec 01 2016
link: Harry J. Smith and Seiichi Manyama, Table of n, a(n) for n = 0..2096 (first 201 terms from Harry J. Smith)
maple: A064629:=n->4^n mod 3^n: seq(A064629(n), n=0..40); # _Wesley Ivan Hurt_, Dec 01 2016
program: (PARI) { f=t=1; for (n=0, 200, write("b064629.txt", n, " ", f%t); f*=4; t*=3 ) } \\ _Harry J. Smith_, Sep 20 2009
(MAGMA) [4^n mod 3^n: n in [0..40]]; // _Wesley Ivan Hurt_, Dec 01 2016
results.author: _Labos Elemer_, Oct 01 2001
